article: The other day, I happened to meet someone I hadn't seen for many years. I couldn't believe the change in him. In fact, he didn't even seem like the  _  person. When I first knew Bill, back in college he was one of the most carefree people I had ever  _  . Bill and I were in the same class in college, and  _  was never dull when he was  _  . With him there was one wild adventure after another. Sometimes I wonder how we  _  to study for our exams. Last week I was in Huston on business and I ran into Bill in the bar at the hotel. At first I wasn't  _  sure it was him. Was this short-haired businessman really the same person? I wasn't really sure until I came near him but it indeed was Bill. Now he works for a bank. He talked most of the evening about his job, his new car and his house. How he had changed! Back when we were in college, the  _  thing Bill cared about was possessions . Now they seemed to be his main  _  . I suppose it' s  _  to expect people to remain the same, especially when I have changed so much myself. But I must say that I enjoyed the old Bill much more than the new one. Maybe he  _  the same way about me.
